column4: does anyone know where I should go for OS X shell scripting help?
and there are lots of fucked up differences, like sed -e 's/blah/\n/' does what you'd expect on linux/freebsd, but not on OS X
older versions may use tcsh but mine sure has bash.
sed is not a bash command
right well I said with bash scripting
sed is a separate tool. it has nothing to do with bash scripting
it includes all those posix tools
you can script those tools with any shell
well thats a matter of opinion, but Ive never seen a bash script of any complexity which doesnt use sed
and learn how the FreeBSD-based sed differs from GNU sed.
basically OS X includes the same tools as most linux distros. just different implementations
you can install gnu versions if you like.
